Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk drm-utils
exit 0

islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk mesa-libgbm
exit 0

commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk mesa-libxatracker-devel
exit 0

function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk xorg-x11-server-Xorg
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: xorg-x11, libdrm, and mesa bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: X.Org is an open source implementation of the X Window System. It provides the basic low-level functionality that full-fledged graphical user interfaces are designed upon. The libdrm packages provide a runtime library for the Direct Rendering Manager. Mesa provides a 3D graphics API that is compatible with Open Graphics Library (OpenGL). It also provides hardware-accelerated drivers for many popular graphics chips. This update fixes the following bugs: OpenGL depth buffers were not handled properly on big-endian platforms. As a consequence, a number of graphical applications displayed a blank window instead of the intended output. Now, OpenGL depth buffers are handled correctly on big-endian platforms and the described problems no longer occur. (BZ#1112753) The LLVM engine for Mesa in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 did not recognize IBM POWER8 systems as compatible with IBM POWER7 systems. As a consequence, OpenGL applications, including gnome-shell, failed to initialize on POWER8 machines. The LLVM engine has been updated to properly recognize POWER8 systems, which fixes the problem. (BZ#1091289) Input events and the internal timekeeping of the X server used different system clocks, which could cause touchpad click actions to be delayed. This update modifies the synaptics driver to use the same system timer as the core server, and touchpad clicks are no longer delayed. In addition, the three-finger tap emulation of a middle-click is now detected more reliably. (BZ#1138484, BZ#1123297) The X server in some cases did not properly synchronize the keyboard LED state during suspend or other hot-plug events. Consequently, the NumLock and CapsLock LED lights on the keyboard sometimes did not correspond with the NumLock and CapsLock status of the system. The LED synchronization has been corrected and the NumLock and CapsLock LEDs now reliably reflect the system status. (BZ#1047921) For certain GPU cards, a number of input events were not translated correctly after using the RandR tool to rotate the screen. As a consequence, the mouse pointer position did not reflect where mouse clicks were sent, and it was not possible to interact with the graphical desktop. Now, input events are translated correctly after using RandR rotation, and the desktop stays usable. (BZ#1067760) The Xephyr tool did not calculate the DPI of its root window correctly, which caused fonts in Mozilla Firefox and other applications to be too small to read when run inside the X sandbox window. With this update, Xephyr calculates the sandbox window DPI properly, which prevents the described problem. In addition, resizable Xephyr windows now use the specified initial size more reliably. (BZ#1086772, BZ#1128353) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: Updated Synaptics drivers have been implemented which introduce software-emulated button click areas for clickpads on Lenovo *40 hardware. This provides for a smoother user experience while using the Lenovo *40 clickpads. Note that this enhancement requires the kernel-3.10.0-140.el7 version or later to function properly. (BZ#1093050) The Xorg server has been linked as a Position-Independent Executable (PIE), which enables additional address space randomization. This increases the difficulty of successfully exploiting buffer overflows and improves the security of X server. (BZ#1092541) Hardware 3D support for the Intel Generation 8 graphics chips, which are a part of the 5th Generation Intel Core Processors, has been added to Mesa. (BZ#1085981) Mesa's LLVM engine has been upgraded to version 3.5, which adds support for the little-endian variant of IBM Power Systems architecture to Mesa. (BZ#1126082) These packages also include a number of other bug fixes and enhancements. For additional details, see the "Bugs Fixed" section below. Users of xorg-x11, libdrm, and mesa are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
